title: New Investigation (2025-04-19 22:43)
summary: Investigation of 10 problematic pods in namespace 'default'.

conversation.content: Based on my analysis of your Kubernetes cluster, I've detected 10 problematic pods including configmap-error, failing-job-2jdjm, failing-job-4ndjw, and 7 more. There are also 5 recent warning/error events that may indicate issues. I recommend checking the suggested actions below to investigate further.

The cluster analysis reveals significant operational issues in the default namespace, with 23 pods experiencing various problems. The main issues include multiple failing jobs with exit code 1, containers in CrashLoopBackOff state (including crash-pod and liveness-probe-fail with over 200 restarts each), storage-related problems (failed PVC provisioning and evicted pods due to volume limits), and service connectivity issues (missing selectors and mismatched labels). The cluster appears to be in a degraded state requiring immediate attention to address container crashes, storage configuration, and service networking problems.

data.summary: The cluster analysis reveals significant operational issues in the default namespace, with 23 pods experiencing various problems. The main issues include multiple failing jobs with exit code 1, containers in CrashLoopBackOff state (including crash-pod and liveness-probe-fail with over 200 restarts each), storage-related problems (failed PVC provisioning and evicted pods due to volume limits), and service connectivity issues (missing selectors and mismatched labels). The cluster appears to be in a degraded state requiring immediate attention to address container crashes, storage configuration, and service networking problems.
